application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T1-Horse Chestnut- Reduce all aspects of the canopy back to the most recent pruning points, taking the height from approximately 25m to 22m and width from 25m to 20m. Sections of regrowth to be removed are approximately 2-3m in length. Retain shortened furnishing growth for crown continuity and to maintain a continuous canopy outline where possibleT2-Magnolia-Reduce back to live growth to create a more compact shape and encourage new growth to regenerate the crown. Sections of approximately 2-3m to be removedT3-Bird Cherry- Lightly reduce overlong shoots back into main canopy outline, 1-2m from branch tipsThin by 10% to improve appearance
